creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Augustus L. Searle
text: Symbolic of good wishes to the Chinese, the ruyi (literally as you wish) is a scepter-like object first encountered in Buddhist art. Perhaps by virtue of its auspicious name, it became a favorite motif in the decorative arts of the Qing dynasty. Placed on a writing desk, display shelf, or held in the hand, most of these scepters display the auspicious symbols which were common to the 18th and 19th centuries. title: Ruyi Scepter
